page.title: 12RELIGION IN NETHERBURY
page.content: There are 3 churches, all Anglican, in Beaminster, Netherbury and Stoke Abbott. Services in these churches and in 11 other churches in surrounding villages, are conducted by members of a team ministry known as the "Beam Team". There are 3 full time parish priests, 4 retired clergy and 5 lay readers; these 5 are trained and licensed and can lead morning and evening prayer, assist at Communion and conduct funerals. There is at least one service per church every Sunday and mid week worship takes place in private homes. The Bishop of Salisbury said in 1982 "The most wonderful thing of all about your Beaminister Team is that it is written into your charter that you are not an organisation run from the top, or centre, but a sharing partnership to which all contributions are welcomed".
